* The whole point in getting this was just to mess around with my own children, and allow them to prank their friends. But I won't allow it now. It's too stiff. Watch my video.

2-Stars.

title: Beautiful vintage inspired kaleidoscope made of real brass...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Beautiful kaleidoscope designed to look vintage like yesteryear's toys.
* Comes in a nice storage box with a thread on handle.
* For its small size, there is a nice heft to it at 4.3 ounces. It is made of brass.
* Very giftable.
* And of course, the patterns through the scope are awesome to look at!

THE BAD:
-----------
* Nothing, nada, zilch. This is 5-Stars all the way!

title: A very fun and complete box of Halloween party favors...
text: [[VIDEOID:d4a4ef29d2d808c730a9b9bd638b322d]] Very fun box of 136 pieces of Halloween trinkets. These are perfect for goodie bags or to give out during Halloween. My favorite piece inside is the little pumpkin wind-up figure. I'll keep that and give out the rest. LOL! Lots of creepy crawlers, glow in the dark stuff, finger nails, stamps, etc. A very complete box. 5-Stars!

title: Awesome 48 piece goody bags, bundled with 48 pieces of sealing stickers...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Perfect for Halloween goodie bags, or birthday goodie bags in October.
* You get 8 designs at 6 pieces each for a total of 48 designs.
* The size is 7x4x2.4 inches, which is pretty decent. I have it next to a soda can for reference.
* 48 round stickers. At first, I thought they were just bonus throw ins, but since there are 48 pieces, I realize they're for sealing the bags. Very nice.

THE BAD:
------------
* At the price you're paying for 48 bags and 48 sealing stickers, there are no complaints here. 5-Stars!

title: Very unique and innovative t-shirt, and it works very well...
text: We got the small, fits my daughter perfectly. She weighs about 42 lbs, and is about 47 inches tall. This shirt is very fun and unique. The chalk shows on the shirt nice and bright, and when you need to erase, it comes off clean. Very unique indeed. 5-Stars!

title: A very neat Optimus Prime that can be played with or displayed in the colorful open design box...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Lots of cool colorful artwork on the packaging. So as a collector, you can enjoy this Prime without removing him from the box.
* The plastic is not cheap light weight. It is a denser type of high quality plastic.
* Converting to robot is an easy automatic feature. Transforming back to truck requires good old fashion step by step moves using your hands.
* Energon Armor accessories included.
* Ten sound effects, as well as chest lighting effect. Batteries are included for this.

THE BAD:
------------
* I'm not sure if this has enough to pry my son away from his tablet and games. We live in such a tech world that kids are growing out of it quicker than when we were kids in the 80's and 90's. I remember enjoying toys even through junior high. My kid is in 3rd grade and is already growing out of toys. :( I'm hoping this Optimus Prime can spark something. We'll go 4-Stars.

title: Beautiful jeep, but read my review to avoid some potential headaches...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* This is a super detailed 1:12 scale military jeep.
* Windshield wipers move, steering wheel moves.
* Removable shovel and axe latched to the driver side of the jeep. So much detail.
* Jeep clocks in at 1 lb. 5.6 oz. Without battery.
* Remote transmitter weights 5.5 oz. Without batteries. It takes four AAA batteries not included.
* Packaging is also very unique designed as some sort of ration or equipment container you would find in the military.
* Headlights, tail lights, emergency lights, lots of lights!
* Jeep is high quality

THE BAD:
------------
* At this price, are you really going to take it outside? We have several other RCs in the home and we smash those cars up good. Their plastic shells are made to be smashed, and replaced. This Jeep is more of a collectible. With all the detail and fragile moving parts, you will no doubt break something if you take this to the gravel.
* With all the attention paid to the details, I am surprised not a lot of attention was paid to helping us open the hood. The manual just says open the hood to install the battery. Well, this thing is $250, I don't want to break anything. The hood wouldn't open. I eventually figured out that there are two tabs on the sides of the hood that needs to be removed. Look at my pictures to see exactly what you need to remove. Now even after removing these clips the hood wouldn't open. That's because I use very little strength, I didn't want to force anything. But after mauling around for awhile, I figure there is nothing left I need to remove, so I just used extra force to pop the hood, and luckily that was the proper way to do it. There is a clip inside that keeps it from popping up during play, which is the reason why you need to use a little force to pop it open. Maybe these tabs that you need to remove is common sense in this type of model, and experience collectors know this. But the manual shouldn't assume this, they should always write manuals as if they are writing for an audience of new collectors.
* As for the remote controller, there is no room for error, no tolerance for AAA batteries that may slightly differ in diameter. I have found out through experience with other toys that rechargeable batteries can be slightly bigger in diameter than alkaline batteries. Just slightly, I mean your naked eyes can't see the difference. But the battery compartment of some toys are made with no wiggle room, such as the case with this controller. I popped in four AAA rechargeable batteries, but I didn't check the level of the batteries. The controller wouldn't turn on, so I had to remove them to charge them. This was when I found out my big problem!!! The batteries wouldn't come out. With some force and gravity, the top two batteries fell out, but the bottom two were stuck for good. Manual says, do not unscrew or take apart the controller, which was exactly what I had to do, as well as using a micro flat head screwdriver to do some prying. Ultimately, I was able to free the bottom two batteries. I used regular alkaline AAA batteries afterwards, and they slide in and out with no issues. So this is my warning to you.... DO NOT USE RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES, or you will have a good time just like me.

Beautiful jeep, but I'm knocking 2 stars for what I experience setting this jeep up. The manual should have gave more guidance on how to open the hood, and the remote controller needs to be more tolerant of rechargeable batteries that may differ in size slightly than alkaline batteries.

title: More realistic than most stuff animals, the silicone sole under the paws are amazing...
text: My daughter and this dog have been inseparable. It is very cute, and more realistic than most stuff animals. Hence, the premium that you're paying. It has movable ears and tails, but the silicone sole knocks it out the park. It feels like the sole of a real dog. My daughter says 5-Stars!

title: Pretty cool techie, as well as scary, mask for Halloween...
text:
[[VIDEOID:df570ec9761fd734679cf00835c25b15]] THE GOOD:
--------------
* Very vibrant lights.
* Remote control is wired, but you get plenty of length. When I tried it out, I had the remote in my front pant pocket and it still had plenty of slack. The wire can be tucked inside your shirt if you want to conceal it.
* Takes TWO AA batteries, not included.
* Bonus light up gloves are included.
* Very cool tech for such a low price.

THE BAD:
------------
* It's a bit creepy. LOL! My son loves it though. 5-Stars!

title: Very cool giant pig, a terrific gift idea...
text: The pig is shipped to you vacuum sealed in a compact bag. What you do is you open it up and air it out overnight. The next day, it'll be big, nice and fluffy. Your pig will look okay the moment your break the vacuum bag, but you should still let it sit for 24 hrs. to allow all the materials to correct itself. A nice touch by this company is that they included a giant see-through bag decorated with hearts and a ribbon. So once your pig is nice and ready, you can put it in the bag, put the ribbon on it, and present it as a gift. A very thoughtful gesture by Ikasa. 5-Stars!

title: Awesome giant Koala bear with accessories to present it as a gift...
text: The koala is shipped to you vacuum sealed in a compact bag. What you do is you open it up and air it out overnight. The next day, it'll be big, nice and fluffy. Your koala will look okay the moment your break the vacuum bag, but you should still let it sit for 24 hrs. to allow all the materials to correct itself. A nice touch by this company is that they included a giant see-through bag decorated with hearts and a ribbon. So once your koala is nice and ready, you can put it in the bag, put the ribbon on it, and present it as a gift. 5-Stars all the way!

title: A classic must have for Magic performers and collectors...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* High quality brass magic item.
* Easy to learn, easy to perform
* Collectible. In the Magic collectibles world, brass and wood magic products are the most collectible.
* Spectator will handle the gimmick the entire process, until you take it back to perform your x-ray vision.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Nosey family members, problem solvers, college students, etc., should not be handed the gimmick after the performance.. they will figure it out. This was one of the first tricks I ever owned as a kid, so when I saw this, I had to get it for my son. He still hasn't figured it out yet, but he's 8. Smart teenagers or College students can figure it out easily if you let them examine it all day. But they say in magic, if it ever gets to that point where people want to examine your props, then your whole presentation is wrong. Try to entertain and do magic. Don't make it seem like puzzles, or brain teasers, because then spectators view it as a challenge they have to figure out.

5-Stars!

title: Very funny and realistic baguette pillow...
text: Soft and comfy. It looks very real. You can put it in the middle of a dining table, and your family will think they're getting baguette for dinner. LOL! 5-Stars!

title: Awesome Akedo mini battling characters to add to your collection...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Bundle pack of 4 figures, including a mystery figure.

THE BAD:
-----------
* No Arena or joysticks. You cannot start off with this kit. This bundles is simply to add on characters to your existing kit. You need the Battle Arena kit, or any kits that have joysticks included. My kids are addicted to collecting these figures. 5-Stars!

title: Nice assortment of characters to build on to your Akedo collection...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Bundle pack of 7 figures total including mystery figure.
* 1 Training dummy.
* 1 Joystick controller.

THE BAD:
-----------
* You cannot start off with this kit. There is only 1 controller. You need to purchase an extra controller, or start with the Battle Arena kit, then build your collection from there. Understand that, and you'll love these characters!
* The figures are wedged super tight inside the clear plastic liners. Feels like you're going to break them when you're popping them out, so be careful. These are just FYI's, and nothing to dock stars for. We still give it 5-Stars!

title: Super fun, arcade inspired toy that will keep kids busy, at least for awhile...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Perfectly priced toy for the quality you're getting.
* Collectible.
* Like Rock-Em Sockem, but with electronics, and the figures will split when getting knocked out.
* This version come with an arena, but you can fight without it if you wish.
* Two warriors included to get you started.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Nothing I can think of. The price is just right for what you're getting. I don't recall an actual arcade game in the past called Akedo. It seems this toy is simply inspired by all the classic arcade fighting games such as Street Fighter, Fatal Fury, Tekken, etc. It will keep your children occupied for awhile and away from tablets.

One more thing, the two default figures that's already installed in the arena have clear bands wrapped around them. We saw the vertical bands on their bodies and cut them off. But when we battled, we still couldn't split each other. My son realize there are more tiny bands in the neck that needs to be cut. So if you're playing for awhile, and you can't knock anybody out, check to see if rubber bands are still holding their bodies tight. You can manually check... you are free of bands when you can pop their heads back and split their bodies. If you can't do that, it probably means there are some bands you still need to cut off.

5-Stars!

title: This bubble gun is super tiny...
text:
I recently got a different gatling bubble gun. So we thought this is the same, just different color. Boy were we wrong. This thing is super tiny. This is my pet peeve in marketing. Blow up stock photos to make them look bigger than life. They do reveal the size the gun in the 5th picture, but still, they know what they're doing. The fine print is in the 5th pictures because they're hoping you don't look no further after the first few pictures. It is my pet peeve. The other gun we reviewed is 17 inches long, sound effects and bubble holder. Look at our pictures for a comparison. This tiny gun has no bubble holder, the bubble is poured into a separate mini tray where you then dip your gun. But you know what, it works very well. It makes a lot of bubbles. But how is it that this tiny gun can cost more than the 17 inch gun here? https://www.amazon.com/review/R3JT58F8EGI924/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B092ZGX4G6

For essentially the same money... which would you buy? The only reason I'm not going to give this gun a 1 star for being misleading in product photos, as well as being overpriced compared to bigger better guns, is because my little girl had a lot of fun with it. So I'll give it 2-Stars!

title: Pool-side giant connect four just like the resorts...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* The plastic molds are high quality durable plastic.
* Easy to assemble, just click parts together, no screws, no tools.
* It feels like the same jumbo sets you can find at resorts like LegoLand. They put out these giant Connect Four sets for kids to play. This set reminds me of the one we saw at Legoland.
* It is HUGE! 4 ft wide, by about 3.5 ft tall.
* A nice surprise is a bonus carrying case. I've seen these cases sold separately. I was surprised one is included.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Nothing at all. Well, we haven't found the space for it in our home, so that's a bad, but it's our bad. LOL! I looked at the manual, and we'll be putting this up in no time, very easy. I included pictures of the assemble instructions so you can see for yourself. 5-Stars!

title: Educational, and keeps your kids busy...
text: My kids loved this project! Kept them busy for a good while. After they found all the gems, they asked me to buy them the next level. I said, "What do you mean next level?" I realize on the packaging, it says LEVEL 1. So I started searching Amazon, "Gemstone dig kit level 2," but there is no such thing. I don't think this set is part of a series or anything. Other gemstone dig kit sellers aren't advertising any sort of level either. Oh well, the good thing is that they asked me to buy more, which means they liked this activity a lot. 5-Stars!

title: Very cute, soft and cuddly bunnies...
text: Bunnies have been coming around our front lawn recently, so my daughter has caught the bunny bug! She absolutely adores these bunnies. They are very high quality, very cute, soft and plush. 5-Stars all the way!

title: Nice 14 piece set including lids, but be careful with certain pieces...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* High quality wood.
* 14 pieces if you count the two lids, plus nice drawstring pouch.
* Salt and pepper shakers actually make sounds.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Not sure if this is a bad, but more like a be careful. The two knives are thin enough to be dangerous. So some supervision may be necessary depending on how young your kids are.

I would be more comfortable if the knives were thicker. I'll rate this set 4-Stars.

title: These are very light hollow plastic toys...
text: Hmm, not that good. The pieces are hollow plastic. The velcro on the chopstick was a lazy design. It was adhesive velcro wrapped around the stick. A more professional design would be to have the thickness of the tip of the chopsticks thinner than the rest. This way, when you add the velcro, it would be flush would the rest of the stick. BTW, your kids will soon pick up hair and dirt on it. LOL! We'll rate this 3-Stars.

title: Colorful, durable, high quality hand shovels...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* You get three colorful hand shovels.
* They are 14 inches long.
* They are durable, the plastic is not flimsy. This is not dollar store quality.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Nothing at all. My first concern was whether or not these will feel like dollar store toys, and to my pleasant surprise, these are very high quality durable shovels. 5-Stars!

title: Reversible and collapsible, these are game changers for the beach...
text: These are game changing, awesome, reversible pails. It's first job is to carry water, and it's second job is to create sand castle molds. We haven't had a chance to go to the beach with these buckets, but I know my kids will love them. Best of all, they are collapsible to save space! 5-Stars!

title: I think these 22 inch beach shovels will get the job done...
text: Very sturdy shovels! My kids have been using little dinky shovels at the beach. They are going to love these shovels. What more can I say, they are plastic beach shovels at 22 inches long, and the quality seems good. 5-Stars!

title: Great quality wooden hippo, but there are better value propositions...
text: I've been seeing many of these wooden animal figurines with rope for limbs on Amazon recently. This hippo is nicely done, very smooth polished finish. The rope has bendable wire inside so you can pose him a bit. But I must say this is way overpriced compared to competitors that are charging around $15 to $20, but you get 3 to 4 figures. I'm knocking 2 stars for not being a good value preposition.

title: Nice kitchen toys for sensory play...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Very high quality wooden toys.
* 9 piece set, but if you count the 2 lids, then it's 11 piece total with carrying bag.
* It will keep your child who is interested in cooking busy.

THE BAD:
------------
* Need to buy your own sensory beans, marbles, etc.
* 1st stock photo of everything sitting in a tray is a little misleading. No tray is included.

So keep in mind when you view my pictures, the beans and the clear container holding the beans were not included, that's from my own home. I rate this package 4-Stars!

title: This is not your traditional water gun, read my review to understand what this is...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* For a water gun toy, it is relatively high quality.
* Unique design, not your usual pump action. To load it up, you dip it in your pool or bucket of water and you pull the pump/plunger up like a syringe until the tubes are full.

THE BAD:
-----------
* As mentioned above, you load water by pulling up the pump/plunger like a syringe. Well, just like a syringe, you only get one shot. You can break it down into multiple shots by not pushing the plunger back all the way, but little by little, but that's no fun cause the water doesn't travel far. So to really have fun, you have to do a full one shot blast. In the product's stock photos, seller compares this gun to other guns and demonstrating how this gun has more capacity. Well, I think that's a bit misleading because this is not a traditionally water gun. A lower capacity traditional water gun will last longer before you have to refill. This gun requires reloading after every shot. This can be considered a hassle or nuisance.

It's unique, it's high quality, I'll still rate this 4-Stars!

title: Very neat mini Lego display that will connect with others in collection line...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Spacious for Lego figures at 6.5Lx3Wx6H.
* Touch sensor to turn on auto changing led lights. After 15 minutes, it will turn off to save battery.
* Lego Ninjago figure and diorama accessory included. The diorama looks a like Wing Chun wooden dummy, except with swords. LOL!

THE BAD:
-----------
* Seem out of place with just 1. You'll have to collect others. LOL! The make others and they will look good if you have multiple sets stacking together on display.

This is 5-Stars!

title: Basic pencil box with one Lego figure included...
text:
This Lego box is kind of plain. You can achieve the same effect by buying a plain pencil box, then pasting Lego base plates on it. LOL! But I guess it wouldn't be nice and flush like the base plates on this box. You also get one figure inside. If you get their color pencil set, all 12 will fit into this box. Here is a link to the Lego color pencils: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QB7XDM5

We'll go 4-Stars!

title: Must be a big time Lego fan to justify this purchase...
text:
I guess if you're a big time Lego fan, this would be worth it. But for 12 color pencils and one Lego piece, this is not a good value proposition. If you'll be collecting all Lego office/school products, you'll be happy to know all 12 pencils will fit inside their pencil box. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08MB72J1M

Worth it to the Lego fan, subtracting 1 star for the price. 4-Stars!

title: Cool handheld maze game that is not only a toy, but could be used as retro decor...
text: I got the gray one for my son, so I had to get this purple one for my daughter. This handheld maze game reminds you of the 80's, so not only is it a toy, but could be retro decor too. I'm not certain what the rules are. My 8 yr old boy holds it above his head, so the thing is upside down, and he beats it in minutes. LOL! My girl is only 6, so she doesn't know how to cheat, she just plays normally and hasn't beaten it yet. There are 4 screws in the back in case you're curious to take things apart. 4-Stars!

title: Unique water guns in the shape of animals...
text: Not your usual boring water guns. The animal shapes makes them a little unique. The pumping action isn't difficult at all for little kids. Some water guns require a bit strength to pump, but these were fairly easy. My 6 yr old girl had no problems with them. 5-Stars!

title: Not too difficult for my 8 yr old...
text: I got this because it remind me of the 80's. Back when simple toys like these keep us occupied. Although I don't remember ever seeing a maze game this huge. LOL! I'm not certain what the rules are. My 8 yr old boy holds it above his head, so the thing is upside down, and he beats it in minutes. LOL! I think it's cool to collect, but it won't entertain you for long. We'll rate this 4-Stars.

title: Beautiful play tent that's relatively easy to put together...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* PVC frame creates a very sturdy structure.
* Lights with on/off switch provided.
* Carrying bag.
* Once assembled, it looks pretty much like the stock photo, it's beautiful.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Putting the fabric on the PVC frame wasn't intuitive, but it wasn't impossible to figure out. Maybe mommy would have had an easier time figuring out which end of the fabric is what. But this daddy got the job done, took a little longer, but I did it. LOL!
* You cannot put it away without dismantling the entire frame. They are connect by pvc pipes. We have another play tent that simply pops open and can be folded away easily, but It's round. I guess if you want this house design with 90 degree angle, engineers haven't figured out a pop-up version yet.

Despite some comments listed under bad, my daughter loves this tent very much. I will give it 5-Stars!

title: Perfect for a nice quiet game of Mahjong...
text: These cards are perfect for learning how to play Mahjong, or if you already know how to play, its perfect for playing a quiet game. LOL! No noisy tiles to scramble. Although I have to say, it's just not the same. You need to play with tiles. I just got these because it's a pretty cool novelty to collect. It's plastic and will last a long time, not cardboard like playing cards. 5-Stars!

title: Keep in mind there is no trigger, this water gun shoots by pumping action...
text: Great looking water guns. There is no trigger. You have to pull to shoot, so the pumping action might be difficult for children under 5. Feels like good quality guns. Comes out to about $10 a piece, not bad. Summer is coming up. 5-Stars!

title: Perfect compliment for elementary school math learning...
text: Perfect compliment for kids in elementary school. I don't know about the upper grades, but from K to 2nd grade, I've seen a lot of math problems with these cube illustrations. When they have something tangible in their hands to go along with the visual problem in the book, it really does help them understand faster. 5-Stars!

title: Keep looking, this is terrible...
text: I was hoping this "toy" actually could focus as it claims. It looks nice, but it does a terrible job at focusing. Mine is also bent at the eyepiece. At first I'm thinking maybe that's why mine can't focus, but as I search other reviews, I think it'll make no difference if I get a replacement. If this weren't a Vine item, I would return it.

title: Stock up for the summer! These water guns are super fun...
text: Super fun! I put all 6 guns in a bucket outside, and let my kids go at it! With cheap water guns, there's a good chance they'll feel like dollar store quality. But not these, they feel perfectly adequate for their price. The water shooting action is very nice. Feels like something that belongs at the big name stores' summer aisle. 5-Stars!

title: Very unique colors for water guns...
text: What stood out to me about these water guns is the color schemes. It's different. It's not the usual bright colors to grab kids' attention like yellow, red, dark blue, etc. Instead, it's earthy, pastel-like and neutral. I'm hoping this will get my wife interested in having a shoot out with the kids this summer. LOL!

title: Ikasa stuff animals are awesome, and they make great gifts...
text: This sloth is our favorite of all the Ikasa stuff animals! The sloth is shipped to you vacuum sealed in a compact bag. You simply break the seal and free the sloth. Most of the sloth will look okay the moment you open the vacuum bag, but facial expressions can be off a little, so I would let it sit for 24 hrs. to allow all the materials to correct itself. A nice touch by this company is that they included a giant see-through bag decorated with hearts and a ribbon. So once the sloth is nice and ready, you can put it in the bag, put the ribbon on it, and present it as a gift. 5-Star in quality and thoughtfulness!

text: The tiger is shipped to you vacuum sealed in a compact bag, which is inside of a cardboard box. You simply break the seal and free the tiger. title: Awesome 2-n-1 Lebron basketball stuff doll...

She will love it! 5-Stars!

title: Terrific stuff animals from an innovative company...

Most of the lion will look okay the moment you break the vacuum bag, but facial expressions can be off a little, so let it sit for 24 hrs. to allow all the materials to correct itself. So once the lion is nice and ready, you can put it in the bag, put the ribbon on it, and present it as a gift. 5-Star in quality and thoughtfulness!

title: Awesome giant sheep, and very giftable...
text: The sheep is shipped to you vacuum sealed in a compact bag. What you do is you open it up and air it out overnight. The next day, it'll be big, nice and fluffy. Most of the sheep will look okay the moment your break the vacuum bag, but still let it sit for 24 hrs. to allow all the materials to correct itself. So once Sheep is nice and ready, you can put it in the bag, put the ribbon on it, and present it as a gift. 5-Star in quality and thoughtfulness!

title: Unbelievable space set that is compatible with Lego...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Compatible with Lego
* 1091 pieces
* You get to build the whole shabang! Rocket launcher, space shuttle, some sort of truck/rover, satellite.
* Must have for kids who are into their space phase.

THE BAD:
-----------
* CN logo. We will try to make custom US logos and flag stickers to cover them. But you knew this before purchasing, so it's not something that deserves docking. This is a super duper 5-Star item.

title: Super fun realistic front loader construction truck...
text:
THE GOOD:
-------------
* Mixture of diecast and sturdy plastics, the shovel part is metal, as well as the cabin.
* Shovel loading action is smooth.
* 2 battery packs included
* Looks realistic. If your kid makes YT videos, this can be a prop to represent a real 1:1 Front loader truck.

THE BAD:
-----------
* There are plastics, but sturdy. Not completely diecast
* Need a sandbox at home or take to the park or beach

We'll go 4-Stars because we thought this was all metal.

title: Think out the box.. will be using them as cake toppers...
text: 2 inch figures that feel really cheap, like vending machine toys. In this day and age of smartphones tablets and game consoles, these types of figures are going to end up in the bin collecting dust. The only reason I got it is because there is a big Lebron fan in our family, and her birthday is coming up. I plan to use these as cake toppers. I would go 3 stars, but because it's going serve a purpose for me, I'm giving this 4-Stars!

title: Awesome 1:6 scale Lebron James Space Jam 2 action figure with plenty of accessories...
text: This is a terrific Laurence Fishburne action figure! I'm just kidding. LOL! Of all the Space Jam 2 toys I've grabbed, this is my favorite because we collect 1:6 scale figures. This isn't high end like Hot Toys or Sideshow, but it's 1:6 scale and can blend in with our collection. Comes with great accessories which I assume will be showcased in the upcoming movie. $20 seems to be the right price for this. 5-Stars!

title: Awesome realistic Excavator made of a mixture of diecast and sturdy plastics...
text:
THE GOOD:
-------------
* Mixture of diecast and sturdy plastics
* Digging action is awesome, as long as dirt is loose
* 2 battery packs included
* Looks realistic. If your kid makes YT videos, this can be a prop to represent a real 1:1 Excavator.
* Sounds and lights can be turned off

THE BAD:
-----------
* There are plastics, but sturdy. Not completely diecast
* Need a sandbox at home or take to the park or beach
* Huina logos ( Will try cover them with custom made CAT logos)

We'll go 4-Stars because we thought this was all metal. Maybe we're expecting too much.

title: Excellent material, colorful, inflatable pool hammocks...
text: Hasn't been cold enough to swim yet, but we're looking forward to using this. Very colorful, and material seems excellent. There is a little strange burning smell, so my advice is to air it for 24 hrs before using. Comes with a pump. 5-Stars so far!

title: Nice partially diecast RC truck with great dumping action...
text:
THE GOOD:
-------------
* Cabin portion of the truck is diecast
* Dumping action is awesome
* Working head and tail lights
* Super fun

THE BAD:
-----------
* Only cabin is diecast, rest is plastic
* Huina Logos (I will try and make CAT logos to cover over them.)
* Unless you have a sandbox at home, you need to take to the beach or park

Overall, very cool RC toy. We'll go 4-Stars for not being 100% diecast.

title: Alternately, you can use these as cake toppers...
text: We plan to use these as cake toppers for a crazy Space Jam fan in our family. You get 4 little 2 inch figures, but one of them is a mystery. If not for the cake topper idea, I don't think we'd buy or collect these. They look like cheap happy meal toys. We rate this one 3-Stars!

title: Neat old school type action figure of Lebron James...
text: Very neat 5" inch Lebron James figure from the upcoming Space Jam 2 movie. For $10, you can't expect too much detail. That's why this figure also looks like Laurence Fishburne. LOL! Still 5-Stars!

title: Colorful, soft, snuggly and no shedding...
text: The red paws and nose really gives this stuff animal some aesthetic pop! My daughter loves this lion, and can't be separated from him. Very soft, snuggly and no shedding. 5-Stars!

title: Another terrific Space Jam 2 toy...
text:
This is probably my favorite of all the Space Jam 2 sets we've gotten. They offer a different set that uses launchers to launch the ball. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08GCZQQP1

However, with this set, you can actually launch the Lebron figure to dunk at the rim. LOL! Lebron can also shoot the ball from his hands. You can play horse with this set by taking turns. 5-Stars!

title: Very fun miniature horse basketball game with figurines...
text: This is surprisingly fun to play. It isn't just figurines, you can shoot the ball with the included launchers. If this weren't the internet age, you basketball fan children would play for hours. I think I can keep my kids busy for at least 30 minutes with this. LOL! The price is also proper for what you're getting. 5-Stars!

title: One of the best toys we have ever owned...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* I was expecting slow trotting motion, but this Raptor moves pretty fast, not fast like a RC car, but realistic speed for a dinosaur.
* Remote is very easy to learn, my 6 yr old got it in no time.
* Adults will want to play with it too. LOL!

THE BAD:
-----------
* You'll want to buy more! LOL! Our kids each have one and they let the Raptors battle. First one to tip over loses. They charge each other and they get into these gridlocks. My kids realized that if they're the first to reverse their Raptor, the other one will fall over due to the momentum. LOL! It is extremely fun to play with. I highly recommend this RC Raptor!

5-Stars!

title: Very neat spider robot kit...
text: Recommended for 12 and up, but I'm going to make this a project with my 8 yr old who is into robots and gaming. Everything looks high quality and complete. The kit is very giftable too. We'll update this review when we put it together. So far it's 5-Stars!

title: Finally, RC dinosaurs! A great invention...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* It is fast. I was expecting slow trotting motion, but this Raptor has some speed. Not as fast as a car, but realistic fast for a dinosaur.
* Remote is easy to learn, my 6 yr old got it in no time.
* Adults will want to play with it too. LOL!

THE BAD:
-----------
* You at least need two! LOL! Our kids each have one and they let the Raptors battle. First one to tip over loses. If you watch basketball, there is something called "pulling the chair out under the offensive player." So imagine Lebron backing up a defender, the defender decides to simply walk away instead of bodying up Lebron. Because Lebron is using a lot of force, he will fall over when there is nothing there to lean against. Well, we do something similar with these Raptor battles. They charge each other and they get into these gridlocks. My kids realized that if they're the first to reverse their Raptor, the other one will fall over due to the momentum. LOL! It is a blast to play with!

5-Stars!

title: Possible best RC toy ever...
text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* It is fast. I was expecting slow trotting motion, but this Raptor can chase down your GI Joes!
* Remote is easy to learn, my 6 yr old got it in no time.
* Adults will want to play with it too. LOL!

THE BAD:

title: Great binoculars for the little ones with little to no eye strain...
text:
THE GOOD:
-------------
* Great size for children under 10.
* I tested it at length, and felt no eye strain.
* Instructions are good, you'll learn to easily focus this.
* Neck strap and carrying case.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Your kids will constantly knock it out of focus. It is possible to teach them how to focus it themselves, especially if your kid has a good attention span. It involves covering one lens, while making adjustments, then covering the other lens and making more adjustments. I think if your kid is 8 and up, give it shot and teach them.

This is still 5-Stars for the price!

title: Best crayons I've ever seen...
text: The best thing about these crayons is that the heads don't dull or go flat as fast. Since they are longer, you need to teach your kids to not hold it with too much pressure because they'll break. Non-stick, washable, non-toxic. Nothing to complain about. They look good in our bamboo lazy susan tray: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08MB5PQM1/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

title: A real shopping cart shrunk down for kids...
text: This shopping cart is serious! It's basically a real shopping cart in a mini size. The caster wheels, the frame, everything is heavy duty quality. In my pictures, you'll see I have it next to a plastic Target toy shopping cart. The Target version holds more, but has no seat, and the bottom rack is unusable. The bottom rack of this shopping cart is nice and flat, so your child could fit sodas or water down there. You know how it's too heavy, so you just leave it at the bottom and have the cashier take the scanner to the drinks? Well, your kids can do that too. LOL! 5-Stars!

title: Very fun, super fast, high quality inner body...
text:
THE GOOD:
-------------
* Very fast. 36 km/h in rc cars is very fast.
* The body housing the motor and battery feels very high quality
* Outer shell should be replaceable.
* 80m (260 ft) transmission range
* Good suspension system.

THE BAD:
-----------
* The outer shell will break if you slam it hard into a wall. At least Altair does not claim their shell is durable and won't break like other sellers. The shell will absolutely break.
* A bit of a learning curve for kids when it comes to steering.
* The locking pins is a bit of a hassle. You cannot get to the battery from the bottom, you need to get to it from the top, so you need to remove some pins to remove the shell. Each locking pin has two ridges, I don't know the proper lingo, lets just call it ridges. You don't need to push the pin pass the second ridge. Once it passes the first ridge, you should be good. If you want to push it pass the second ridge, you'll need pliers because your fingers will hurt. But I figure you don't need to since that's how it came out the box, all the pins were only passed the first ridge.

We'll rate this RC car 4-Stars!

title: A step up from the cheaper $20 RC boats. The extra money is worth it...
text: This is an awesome RC boat that goes very fast. The great thing is that there is protective rubber molding in the front bow. When you put the boat on water, it becomes activated, so there is no on/off button on the boat. They provide you with two batteries for the boat, one to serve as back-up. They also provide you with four AA batteries for the remote control. 5-Star all the way! For reference, here is a RC boat in the $20 range. You'll see why the extra money here is well worth it. https://www.amazon.com/review/R24XOHK4ESD701/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B08F558KD8

title: High quality Spanish Doubloon Bronze version...
text: This pouch comes with 35 Spanish Doubloon Bronze coins. We have collected all gold, silver and bronze versions of these replicas. I included a picture to show you how they compare to each other, as well as to a real quarter, nickel and penny. I weighed the gold coins at 2.2 ounces per 10 coins, the silvers are 1.7 ounces per 10, and the bronze are .9 ounces per 10. So this bag of 35 bronze coins weigh 3.15 ounces. We use these coins for encouraging our kids to clean up around the house, do chores, etc. When they collect 10 coins, they can trade them in for a prize. 5-Stars!

title: Awesome nerf type blaster that is fun for both young and old...
text:
THE GOOD:
-------------
* Shoots the darts very good velocity. When playing, be sure to not aim for anyone's face.
* Mechanism seems to function very well. We have not experienced any stuck darts like you normally would with these types of "nerf" toys.

THE BAD:
-----------
* They seem to be very precise with batteries. It requires 4 AAA batteries. Normally, that's all you need to say, right? But they go on to say it works best with Energizer Ultimate, can also be used with Energizer Max, and Duracell Ultra Power. They advised against rechargeable NIMH 1.2v batteries. Basically any brand should work, just don't use nimh batteries. But I get the feeling, the gun might shoot better and even faster with Energizer Ultimate.

Until I encounter batteries I can't use, I still rank this 5-Stars! Of all my kid's nerf type toys, I enjoy this one the most.

title: Very cute, and high quality kit to create 4 snow globes...
text:
March 20, 2021 UPDATE:
-----------------------------
After our family completed this project, I would recommend using very little glitter or no glitter at all. For some reason, I had envision the glitter working like traditional snow globes where the snow settles at the bottom, then you shake it and the snow floats all over the place. Well, this isn't "snow," this is glitter. They simply cling and stick. They will cling to the bottom, to your sculptures, even to the dome, some will even be floating at the top. When you shake your globe, the glitter DOES NOT move. In hindsight, I would have preferred no glitter because they cover your work. So my advice is to use sparingly, or not at all. Still a 5-Star kit!

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
----------------------
This is going to be so much fun for the kids. The kit looks great! Very cute, and It comes with four figurines to supplement whatever your kids will be creating with the clay. The display domes are good quality. Hard plastic and acrylic. It has to be if its going to hold water. This will be a fun session for the kids, as well as the parents. 5-Stars!

title: Crystal is underwhelming and brittle, display cases are cheap flimsy plastic...
text: Nah, I would pass on this. Normally, I would say the end result doesn't matter, it's the process and the family time that counts, but even the process was basically nothing. All you do is stir the crystal powder in boiling water until it all melts. That's it, nothing else for the kids to do. Sit back and wait for the underwhelming results. The crystal forms  a square at the base, so you'll need to break it up in order to fit it on the circular display. The black base and clear dome display are cheap thin plastic. The kind of plastic that is used in packaging that you would normally throw away. The crystal cannot stay still on the base because the dome does not clip onto the base tightly. It just covers the base loosely, so if it moves, the crystal inside moves. We threw away the dome lids, and simply flip the base upside down to use as a tray to hold the crystal, and all it's broken crumbs. That's another thing, it's very brittle. The Science is interesting though. I think I'm most annoyed at the display cases actually. The stock photos make it seem like you're getting glass display cases, or at least acrylic, and the black base looks like hard plastic. What you get is the type of thin plastics used as tray liners in packaging, the flimsy stuff you throw away. 2-Star.

title: Very high quality RC tank, so nice you might not want to use it outdoors...
text: This tank is a real beauty! It has good heft to it, unlike most RC cars in this price range. They are made very light so they could fly. But this tank is solid! I was planning to use this tank out in the fields with the rest of our RC cars, but after I took this out the box, I changed my mind. This guy is going to stay indoors to stay mint and pretty forever. It'll be a challenge though because it's really fast for a tank, and it climbs so easily. The doors actually open, and a perfectly scale figure to seat in this tank would be one of those 3.75 inch GI Joes from the 80's. The battery compartment also houses the charging cable, which is a pleasant surprise. Because charging cables are getting outta control in our house. We have so many gadgets, we started to label the cables, otherwise we get easily mixed up.

title: Only for a specific group of tablet owners, not ready for a wider consumer base...
text:
This has been so disappointing. All I can say is read carefully their list of compatible devices because they mean it. If it's not on that list, it's not going to work. Usually, a list of compatible devices are just a guideline and apps are programmed to be very versatile. Not this app! We have a few iPads in the house, an older iPad which is stuck on IOS 10, so you can't even download the app. But we also have an iPad Air 2 running iOS 14.4, so we figure this one satisfies the iOS 13 and up requirement. No it does not. The Arpedia app will run, but there is NO SOUND. Then I noticed on their list, they don't list Air 2, they only list iPad Air 3. So not only does it have to be running iOS 13 and up, it has to be a specific model as well. I asked about this audio issue in the Q&A, and their answer was simplistic. They say my DO NOT DISTURB might be turned on. However, I checked and it is NOT turned on. If that's the case, my other apps wouldn't have audio either, but they are fine. It is only the Arpedia app that has no audio.

On the Android side, usually apps are programed to run on Android, or not, PERIOD. You either make it work for Android, or you don't. I rarely encounter apps, such as Arpedia, that requires a specific model or brand. So again, you should look at the compatibility list and take the list seriously. We have several Android devices, we found one that worked, a Winnovo P20, but the video is UPSIDE DOWN. Turning on or off the auto rotate in the settings didn't help. If we want the video on screen to be right side up, then we have to flip the book on the table upside down. If we want the book to be right side up, the the video on screen will be upside down. LOL! We also tried several Amazon Fire HD that have the Playstore and google services sideloaded. We get the app to launch, and it will go through the process of recognizing and downloading the book you want to read, but then when it comes time to launch the book, the app crashes.

So basically if you have the latest and greatest products such as Samsung, or newest iPads, you're probably good to go. Everyone else, you can skip this product. It's not ready for a wider audience. Too bad because the materials look interesting, and my kids were just waiting on the sidelines for Dad to make it work, but I couldn't.

title: Very neat custom light saber, worth the price...
text:
[[VIDEOID:acf24d91cee31c0de845571b6cd24d7b]] This is a very nice light saber. Good heft to it with lots of features. There will be a learning curve, but hopefully my tips as well as the video demo will make it easier for you. Remember that it is all in the blinking:

After assembling and charging your saber, you start off in SLEEP mode, meaning NOTHING should be illuminated. Hold the power button until the power ring illuminates and you hear a voice saying POWER ON. Now this is called OFF/AWAKE mode. Off meaning the lights/effects are not turned on yet, but the power button ring is illuminated. More on this OFF/AWAKE state later. But here, you simply tap the button to turn on the lights and effects. Now you are in ON/AWAKE mode, and here are the commands for ON/AWAKE mode:

ON/AWAKE MODE COMMANDS:
-------------------------------------
ONE BLINK: Hold the button until it BLINKS one time, then release. LOCK-UP effect is now enabled. It basically sounds like your saber just hit some electrical wires and is going crazy. Tap the button to get out of it.

TWO BLINKS: Hold the button until it BLINKS twice, then release. The saber will cycle through the color choices. Once you like a color, tap to set your color choice.

THREE BLINKS: Hold the button until it BLINKS three times, then release. You will hear a quote from the movies. To hear a different quote, hold until it BLINKS three times again, then release. Basically keep holding and releasing after three blinks to cycle through the quotes.

FOUR BLINKS: This turns OFF the lights/effects. But, the power ring is still illuminated, which means you are back to OFF/AWAKE mode, and here are the commands for OFF/AWAKE mode:

OFF/AWAKE MODE COMMANDS:
--------------------------------------
ONE BLINK: This allows you to set the sound volume. You can set between NO SOUND, LOUD SOUND, and SOFT SOUND.

TWO BLINKS: This is for light effects. You can have it STABLE, UNSTABLE, or PULSE. Stable gives a consistent solid light, which is what I have on during my demo because it's easier to capture on video.

THREE BLINKS: This is for setting a theme music. You can cycle through 5 songs, and the 6th is no music. So if you leave it at any one of the songs, whenever to turn on the lights/effects, music will be on too. So if you don't want any music, make sure you cycle all the way to no music.

FOUR BLINKS: You can cycle through more movie quotes, one of which is, "The force is with you Luke..."

LASTLY, to put it sleep. Hold the button for 10 seconds, so when you do this. It will go through its blinking, but just disregard them until the red illumination is completely off. This takes about 10 seconds. You are now in SLEEP mode. The same mode as when you first assembled and charged the saber. To play again, hold the power button until it illuminates, and you are back to OFF/AWAKE mode.

title: If you need a huge balloon arch, this is the set to get...
text: This is an excellent balloon arch set. This is one of the bigger sets. Each pole is about 17.25 inches and you get 15 of them. So you can imagine the massive arch you can create with these. Big enough to have the arch on the ground. The poles are made of glass fiber and are very strong. You get 50 balloon clips, a few ballon knotters, two clips to arrange balloons to look like flowers, etc. This set is definitely more grandiose than some of the others on the market. For a big splashy arch, this is the one to buy! 5-Stars!

title: Very cute for Lego and friendship necklace fans...
text: Very cute! My daughter loves it. If it weren't for home-schooling due to covid, she would have a hard time choosing which friend to give one half to, so her brother is the default winner! LOL! 5-Stars!

title: Neat little garden kit, but there are no plant seeds...
text: We were hoping for an all in one kit, but to my surprise, the kit did not provide any plant seeds. I thought we were going to get the seeds to plant the flowers shown in the stock photos. But everything else is present, ready for you to get to work. There is a also a useless ruler they included. They had to bend it to squeeze it in the package, so it's deformed. We'll rate this 4-stars.

title: Awesome complete Bingo set, perfect for family entertainment...
text: My children got their first Bingo experience with this set, and they love it! You need manually remove the Bingo balls like those plastic car model kits where you have to remove the parts from a plastic frame. Just twist the bingo balls and they will fall off the frame. Some may have rough plastic edges still attached to them, so I use a nail filer to smooth it out. There are 75 bingo balls total. They provide you with 500 bingo chips, 50 game boards, 2 drawstring pouches, and a master board to double check the winning numbers. In terms of storage, I feel the best place to store the bingo balls is actually in the metal cage itself, not the drawstring pouch. I simply use a twisty tie to prevent the scoop mechanism from moving. This way, if the cage moves around, the scoop won't work, so it won't accidentally spit out a bingo ball. BTW, the quality of the bingo balls are pretty good for being plastic. When I saw that they came in plastic frames that you have to remove, I feared the bingo balls would be cheap and hollow, but it doesn't feel that way at all. We give this set 5-stars all the way!

title: Use your Lego to build a world for these Hot Wheels sets...
text:
These Hot Wheels Mega Construct sets are compatible with Lego, so you are only limited only by your imagination. You can use Lego to build a raceway, garage, pit stop, etc., for your Hot Wheels car and figure. This set is called "GT Hunter" and comes with 106 bricks. In comparison to Lego, here are some noteworthy things:

- The Hot Wheels figure is a little shorter and skinnier.
- The Hot Wheels figure has no head under the helmet.
- The Hot Wheels figure has better arm articulation.
- The Lego figure will fit inside these Hot Wheels cars if they're bald. LOL! Meaning if you take off their hair piece, and any other head accessories.

My kid have been cranking these out every day. 5-Stars all the way!
