title: Nice stencil set with bonuses...
text: Along with the stencils, you get some bonuses like color pencils, scissors and clips. My daughter loves to draw and she has made good use out of this set. There is also a blank piece shown in the picture, which is probably the "base" that they refer to. Good stuff. 5-Stars!

title: Awesome balloons with helium alternative adhesives...
text: We can't wait to set these up! Our daughter loves unicorns, so this is perfect. Everything seems to good quality. We will need to decide to fill them up with helium, or regular air, and simply stick them to the wall. In my picture, you can see a little bag with Chinese words on it. That's the "100 pcs glue point gift" the listing mentioned. It's like little clear round adhesives, and they're really sticky, so it should work really well. So you got everything to get up and running. 5-Stars!

title: Perfect decorations for the rainbow and unicorn fans...
text:
Jan 16 update:
-----------------
So we got around to putting the decorations up. The banner is fine, but the balloons are the cheapest balloons I've ever encountered my whole life. These things keep popping while we were inflating them. And the ones that didn't pop, they started popping in the middle of the night. I decided to take all the balloons we blew and purposely popped them in the garage in the middle of the night. Because I didn't want the kids to be playing with them the next day. These are super thin balloons. If you use them, blow them to half of their capacity to be safe. Changing review to 3 Stars.

Original review:
-----------------
My little girl loves rainbows and unicorns, so when I saw this, I had to grab it. The backdrop will need to hang for a few days, or ironed out if you mind the creases and wrinkles. When I first opened up the backdrop, I wasn't impressed. I couldn't see the colors. But this is one of those things where you have to hang it up and take a step back, then you can see the colors from afar. Up close, it looks faded. The balloon array arching over the backdrop is exactly how we're going to set it up. Everything looks to be good quality. 5-Stars!

title: Awesome RC car, but there may be no long-term tech or customer support...
text:
This thing is a blast outdoors, but for indoors and not enough runway, it's a little too powerful for my kids to handle. You can't press the trigger too long, or your truck will go slamming into your furniture and walls. The control is super accurate though. Release the trigger and it stops on a dime. I know you can spend 4 to 5 times this if you truly get into it and become a RC enthusiasts. This is more than enough for my kids who are not yet 10. But the truth is, this one is for daddy. LOL! The best feature of this RC car compared to others is the amphibious feature. It can go on water. We gave it a shot, and it moves exactly like that in the stock video, meaning pretty slow, and it needs to use more battery when it's in water. It's not fun in water, but nevertheless, it's a cool feature to have if you have a pool in your backyard. We were letting it fly off the steps and into the pool, and sometimes it landed on it's back, but won't drown. It's supposed to be water proof, so I'll update this review if anything happens to it.

My only concern is that I've seen this exact car in a different color scheme with a different brand slapped on it. So for such a high priced car, it's a little concerning that it's essentially a white label product. Meaning it's sold to anybody from a manufacture, most likely from China, and anybody can put their own logo on it. So it's not from a known company who you know will be around should you need customer or tech service. If you're not worried about that, this seems like a great car so far.

-Great suspension
-Rugged body
-2x 9.6V 900mAh Ni-MH Batteries
-2 x USB Charging Cable
-1 Remote

Put a camera on this thing and have fun!

title: Awesome kit for the future paleontologist in your family...
text: We got the Tyrannosaurus Rex version! This is a terrific digging kit for the future paleontologist in your family. What you see in my pictures is what you get. There are no instructions, so I take it all you need to do is open everything up and let your kid dig away! LOL! 5-Stars!

title: Recording is a hassle, and value proposition is on the low side...
text:
First off, the instructions are near the back pages of the book. Wouldn't it make more sense if it were in the front? I didn't know this, so I was searching youtube, even went to their website, etc. just to watch videos to figure out how things worked. I took a picture of the instructions to save you some hair pulling.

The touch buttons to hear their default voice works pretty well, but it's when you want to record your own voice is when it gets iffy. You have to hold it to hear a beep, but sometimes the beep won't come. Now when it does beep and you're done with reading the page, you have to hold it again to hear a double beep to confirm it saved. If you don't hold again to hear the double beep, then it will keep recording. The biggest gripe I have is why in the world did they put the save/rec switch in the battery compartment? Why isn't it on the side with the rest of the controls? Every time you want to record, which will be many times!! Because your kids will be like, "Me, me, record me!" You have to take a a screwdriver to open the compartment, switch to rec, do your thing, switch back to save, then screw the battery cap back on. And you have to do that every time your kids want to record again. And you should let them record over and over because they're improving and perfecting their reading. BTW, it takes 3 AAA batteries, which they do include.

So in conclusion, the touch buttons could use some improvement, the save/rec switch should be moved to the side, and lastly, they should lower the price. I don't know if many people will collect beyond 1 book if it's $40 a pop. I think this needs to be more affordable. 3-Stars!

title: A bit pricey for what you get...
text:
After my son and I finished this project, we were pretty underwhelmed. The price is $50, and that's on sale from $99? There is no way this thing should sell for $99, it's still a bit overpriced at $50. Some issues...

1. Our set came with 2 Saturn Arms, missing the Neptune arm. So we had to do a replacement with Amazon.

2. Inserting the pin rods in the planets, then into the arms. This was a pain. There is no way an 8 yr old would have been able to do this. I had to put on gloves to get a good grip to push the pins into the planets. Some of them, you hear a click, and some of them, you get no clicks no matter how hard you push.

3. The center projector that projects each planet is TERRIBLE. You need all the lights off, and you need the whole system to be close to the ceiling for you to see what planet its projecting. Out of focused and blurry. No way to focus it. The only way to get a sharper image is to put the project as close as possible to the wall.

4. Though the arms rotate around the sun, the individual planets do not rotate. So to explain night and day to your child, you'll need to manually rotate Earth. That would be asking too much, but hey, I thought this retails for $99? If they did charge $99, those planets better rotate by themselves. LOL!

3 stars.

title: Very fun and educational as well...
text: What is it about the sight of rolling marbles that is just so satisfying? This is not only fun, but educational. Kids are unknowingly getting a lesson in physics regarding action-reaction. This set has a total of 200 pieces including 20 marbles. One day, when the kids are bored with it, I advise you to not throw it away. Keep it in your garage. I have a feeling these pieces will be useful when your kid gets to Junior High or High School and need to do a project on Chain Reactions. They could use some of these pieces to go along with their own creations. This product is 5-Stars!

title: Terrific piggy bank, but this is the NO MUSIC version.
text:
[[VIDEOID:2264494a691ab83f7ded9335be8b456c]] Right off the bat you should know that this version DOES NOT have music when inserting bills, which an older child may like better. Like my 8 yr old said, "Nursery music are for babies." LOL! The instructions to change the code is in the product listing, but has grammatical errors. Here it is again for clarity:

- Punch in your code, brand-new default code is 0000.
- Open the door, and while the door is open, press and hold the STAR * button.
- The lights will start to flash. Punch in your desired four digit code, then press the NUMBER # button.
- The lights will stop flashing. Now you can release the STAR * button.
- Your new 4 digit code is ready to go!

Watch my video for a little demo, as well as changing the code process. 5-Star product!

title: Awesome bank, this one has music when inserting bills...
text:
[[VIDEOID:8ec5ddd5448ed501c0a62c3eff933c09]] There are plenty of these toy banks offered on Amazon, and I thought they were all the same, but it turns out some of them have music when you insert bills, some of them do not. This version DOES HAVE music. No music is actually preferred by older kids, who thinks it's more realistic. LOL! But if your kid is under 6 or something, this version will be perfect. The instructions to change the code is in the product listing, but their grammatical errors may make it confusing, so here it is again for clarity:

- Punch in your code, brand-new default is 0000.
- Open the door. While door is open, press and hold the STAR * button.
- Lights will start to flash. Punch in desired four digit code, then press the NUMBER # button.
- Lights will stop flashing. Now you can release STAR * button.

I also show this process in the video. 5-Star product!

title: Awesome Fortnite Battle Bus...
text: You have to actually inflate the balloon! That is awesome! There are various light and sound patterns, and the battery compartment is at the bottom of the bus. Requires two AA batteries, not included. The side of the bus opens so you can seat your figures. You can seat a total of 10 figures. Only 2 figures are included. My son is playing Fortnite every day, he loves it. To load up this bus, you should get the Chapter 1 collection of 10 figures: https://www.amazon.com/review/RK5V5A54SEKGY/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8

title: Everything you need to start painting your first rock!
text: I've been trying to add more arts and crafts activities in our home to lessen screen time. This is a nice kit, but some of the rocks broke, you can see the broken pieces in my picture. But you should think a little before buying. We realize we have everything already at home except for the rocks. LOL! You can always be on the look out for rocks. So the thing we looked forward to the most are the rocks, and some were broken. :( I'll subtract 1 star.

title: High quality, super educational, fun, conversation piece...
text: Super educational, as well as a conversation piece. My kid wants to display it on his desk to go for the "school look" he says. LOL! I'm actually a big kid at heart too and collect many 1:6 scale figures, and had a blast putting this together with my son. The posters are high quality and also worthy of being displayed in your kid's room. The muscles and tendons come off easily, but that's by design, so you can strip him down to a skeleton. So tell your children to be extra careful to not lose any parts. Skull can come off to see brain inside, and the brain is removable as well. This is too cool. Why didn't I get this type of toy in my childhood? LOL! 5-Stars!

title: Fun and educational for the kids...
text: Product listing says 12 yrs and up. Don't listen to it. If you have kids as young as 4 and starting to learn adding and subtracting, this game will be super educational! My youngest is 5 and she bugs us every day to play this game. Kids under 12 will love this game, trust me. It's not just adding and subtracting, for more advance play, you can do multiplication, division, any math you can think of. Lets say your roll a 4 and a 3, but you're out of tiles to make 7. But you have a 9 and a 3 in play, well if multiplication is part of the game then 4x3 is 12, hence, you can shut the 9 and 3 tiles. Lets say you roll a 5 and a 4, but you have no more tiles that add up to 9, but you have a 3 in play. What's the square root of 9? It's 3, now you can shut that 3. Any math you can think of is fair game, that's how we play it. Play this game with your kids, and they will learn math faster! 5-Stars.

title: Awesome Lego-compatible RC robot...
text:
[[VIDEOID:4962d08909d83f2f5dc840da1eb20e3d]] These sets are Lego-like and are Lego compatible. So you can build upon or modify your robot with standard Legos if you wish. It is especially a great opportunity for parent/child bonding time. We already put together a similar robot that is half the cost of this one. So if you wanna give this a try, but weary of its quality. If the less a expensive one a try first: https://www.amazon.com/review/R3H6IM925W9SS9/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8

App and packaging logo looks the same, so it's by the same manufacture. But these are white label items from China. Meaning different sellers will sell them under different brand names. But they all seem to use the same MOULD KING app. If you own several of these robots, you can access all their controls under this Mould King app. I made a screen recording to demonstrate. However, this app is NOT available in the Google Play store. You'll need to use a QR scanner to scan their code, and it'll take you to a link to download. But it is available in the Apple Store.

Overall, we like these toys a lot. The only thing that keeps it from being 5-Stars, is the lack of Google Play certification.

title: Huge version of a classic, but has cosmetic imperfections...
text: Pretty cool. Ours is the 25x23 version. The chips are plastic and look like those plastic hockey pucks included in those mini air-hockey tables. Don't expect fine woodworking. This is mass produced woodworking. I've taken a few pictures to show you the imperfections you can expect. There are minor nicks and marks, paint chips, etc. So if you are picky about those things, you might want to skip this product. But it looks easy enough to fix or paint over. I think one day, I'll spray paint this another color. Gray is kind of boring. 4-Stars.

title: Super fun, activates by water, easy to maintain...
text:
Very fun! There is a bit of a learning curve with the controller, but this is how you control it like a master...

-To Go Straight... Press both top left and right buttons
-To turn right... Release right button, while still holding left button. It will keep doing right circles until you press it again to straighten it out.
-To turn left... Release left button, while still holding right button. It will keep doing left circles until you press it again to straighten it out.
-Both left and right lower buttons are useless, no need to use them.

That's it! Keep in mind, when you press both top buttons for it to go straight, the Alligator won't go straight all the time, he'll start to veer on his own. If he veers right, then release the left button, so that he veers back left, if he veers left, then release the right button. You'll get the picture! One last thing, once the batteries are screwed in place, there are no on/off buttons to manage. Once you put the head on the water, it will activate. Once you take it out of the water, it will deactivate. It knows to not drain your batteries when out of the water. I've tested this by seeing if it holds a charge after a week of inactivity, and it absolutely did. Very neat toy, and easy to manage since there is nothing to turn off. Simply take it out of the water!

title: Children can learn about timing while playing hot wheels...
text: This is okay. If not for Vine, I'm not sure I would spend this type of money though. The one good thing is that there is some hand/eye coordination in play, so your children well get some development. You see they have to view an app, which shows a speedometer. They need to keep the needle at a certain speed. Speedometer graphics is broken down into 2 colors, blue and red. If you go to the red, chances are good your car will fly off the tracks. How do you control the speed? By pumping the booster. The faster you pump, the needle will move towards the red. So you need to time yourself and not pump too slow, or too fast to keep the needle in the blue at all times. My kids seem to think it's fun, so that's all that matters. But if you're an adult or an older child, I think you might get bored. Just pumping and watching the car go round and round. All the hardware is top notch. I won't subtract a star for thinking it's boring, since that's subjective.

title: The most powerful booster in their line-up...
text:
Another great set. Compatible with their other Track Builder Unlimited kits. Kinda confusing remembering the different names, but this one is called the SKY CRASH TOWER. It is compatible with other sets such as the POWER BOOST BOX and the Ultra Boost Kit. https://www.amazon.com/Hot-Wheels-Power-Boost-Box/dp/B07Y94SBGX/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_product_top?ie=UTF8

https://www.amazon.com/Hot-Wheels-Unlimited-Configurations-Compatible/dp/B084QF7T3F/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_product_top?ie=UTF8

Some noteworthy things..

-Of all the Track Builder Unlimited kits we've put together, this was the hardest and the instructions were the main culprit. So you may need to use your own logic during the building process.
-This is the most powerful booster in their line-up
-Requires 4 D batteires

Subtracting 1 star for instructions that could have been better.

title: Well made toy, but I don't think 8 yrs and up will enjoy it much...
text:
I'm not sure about the age recommendation of 8 yrs and up. To me, it's more like 5 yrs and down. Your 8 yr old will be amused for a second, then will go back to their tablets and action figures. I see this dog keeping toddlers entertained, but not elementary school kids. My kids have watched with me YT videos of the $3000 Aibo dog. They were not fooled by this dog. LOL!

Regardless, this is a well made toy. The weakest feature is the voice command. It doesn't work all the time. It comes with 2 rechargeable batteries for the dog, which is great since you can always have one back-up ready to go. The remote takes two triple AAA batteries. This dog is basically room decor for my daughter, she thinks its cute, but she doesn't really play with it. We get the most fun out of it by turning it on and watching our real dogs react to them.
This is a well made toy, but subtracting 1 star for the hit or miss voice commands and the targeted age for this toy.

title: Awesome! Watch my video to see this Cyborg hand in action!
text:
[[VIDEOID:df4ff67e8fbd33135e9d6c19c055b894]] This thing is way too cool. Honestly, the end result of this project has been more satisfying than any other stuff I've put together with my 8 yr old. We've built plenty of Lego stuff together, but we never admired the end product as much as we've admired this cyborg hand. It's also a conversation piece. I don't understand some of the complaints. The only way this hand doesn't work is if you messed up, plain and simple. Because really, there is a lot of opportunity for user error. It could be a little mentally draining to follow the instructions, so you need to take breaks if you're not good at focusing. Another tip I have is that you'll need to replenish the water in the pistons from time to time. It will evaporate, and without water the fingers won't bend as much, thus, less gripping power.

-The yellow knob on top of the hand raises or lowers the 3 middle fingers, equivalent to opening or closing the palm of your hands.
-Two red gears allow for the outer fingers to spread.
-Thumb gear allows for it to pivot up and down.
-The pistons control the bending of the fingers, essentially the knuckles.

Watch my video. I demonstrate all the articulation points. This is an enthusiastic 5 stars!

title: Better if everyone is good at it...
text: I think this game would be better with adults. We have two kids, and played it, but it got boring quickly. Too many easy scores. I can envision getting more into it if opponents were more skilled and can block every shot you take. Blocking the marbles from going into your goal is actually the fun part. So in essence, the fun part about this game is the DEFENSE. The offense isn't that fun when you keep scoring and your opponent is not good at blocking the marbles. The better your opponent's defense, the more appreciative you'll be when you score. Even with skilled players, I'm not sure how fun this actually is. It doesn't seem like it's something you'll bust out in the middle of the week after dinner. As a matter of fact, after playing with it on day 1, it has been in its box. It's probably something that's more for parties or when people have had a few drinks. LOL!  The build quality is great. I won't subtract any stars since, I think my opinion is subjective.

title: Track Builder Unlimited kits are super fun!
text:
Terrific set. Compatible with their other Track Builder Unlimited kits. Kinda confusing remembering the different names, but this one is called the ULTRA BOOST KIT. It is compatible with other sets such as the POWER BOOST BOX. https://www.amazon.com/Hot-Wheels-Power-Boost-Box/dp/B07Y94SBGX/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_product_top?ie=UTF8

You'll need 4 D batteries. Set them up any way you want. The more kits you have, the more versatile your imagination can get. 5 Stars!

title: Your Fornite children fans will worship you for at least a month...
text: Honestly, I know nothing about Fortnite. All I know is that my son plays it, and these Fortnite sets have made me the coolest dad, at least for the month. This set only has 2 figures, so it's mainly about the two characters and their accessories. Initially, I wondered is this like opening up blind packs? Hence, the vending machine theme? But it's not like that at all. All the packs inside are building materials, so you cannot hand them out like blind assortments. Once you put the cube together, it is gigantic! To truly get an idea what this is all about, I recommend searching Fortnite Vending Machine on YT to see more experience gamers unbox and talk about this set.

title: If your kid is a Fortnite fan, they will go crazy!
text: Honestly, I know nothing about Fortnite. All I know is that my son plays it, and he recently asked for something called a Battle Pass. I have bought myself some time by giving him these figures. LOL! I must say, they are pretty cool, and they remind me of my childhood with those 3.75 inch GI Joes and Star War figures. Each figure is so detailed with colors that pop. If your kid is a Fortnite player, you can't go wrong with this!

title: Beautiful Schleich horses and training caravan for your diorama...
text: In the world of miniature animal figurines, we've collected Schleich, Safari LTD, and Papo. The Schleich brand have never disappointed, and I believe the majority believe they are the best. I can't wait to set this up for my daughter, but first she has to earn good grades in school. There is a plethora of accessories in this kit, and I've taken pictures of the 4 horses included in this set to give you an idea of its quality. They say it's 5-12 yrs, but I know adults who collect Schleich and these prices are a reflection of that fact. But they are definitely worth it.

title: Requires 24 AAA batteries for Four to Play...
text: [[VIDEOID:62b25018677c627f660ea5da9267496]] Super fun! But you need a back yard, and you need 24 AAA batteries. Listing says each vest and gun requires 4 AA batteries, which is incorrect. Each vest and gun requires 3 AAA batteries, so a total of 24. This is well made, and the sounds are loud and crisp. Watch my video to hear the sounds and how to set up a team. 5 Stars.

title: A cool fidget alternative...
text: [[VIDEOID:9bd08e53f1c5f374b7fbd30746abdf83]] If you've gotten bored of fidget spinners, this is a neat alternative. I was playing with this during Laker games. You don't even have to look it at, just go by feel, and the magnets will snap things in place. I have yet to look at any Shashibo tutorials. I'm sure if you learn it, you can systematically get to a targeted shape. But I like just seeing what random shapes I can create. The magnets, the crunchy sound, the sound of snaps when things fall into place.. it truly can be used as a fidget device. Watch my video, you'll see how I just accidentally go back to the cube shape. LOL! However, I will give this a 4 star. I think it's a little over priced for what it is. The graphics are basically a sticker that will fade, or peel over time. I think around $10 to $15, they can sell more.

title: I consider this a colorful fidget toy...
text: [[VIDEOID:1fc7e05a9ee9b114acf2657358e948f3]] This is better than just a boring spinner. I was playing with this during the NBA playoffs. You don't even have to look it at, just go by feel, and the magnets will snap things in place. I have yet to look at any Shashibo tutorials. I'm sure if you learn it, you can systematically get to a targeted shape. But I like just seeing what random shapes I can create. The magnets, the crunchy sound, the sound of snaps when things fall into place.. it truly can be used as a fidget device. Watch my video, you'll see how I just accidentally go back to the cube shape. LOL! However, I will give this a 4 star. I think it's a little over priced for what it is. The graphics are basically a sticker that will fade, or peel over time. I think around $10 to $15, they can sell more.

title: Must have for Super Mario fans...
text: [[VIDEOID:c6bfff875e49ab62928410cf11cd3f58]] We haven't taken this guy out of the box. We display it in his box next to the Nintendo Switch in the family room. He's a mixture of plastic and plush, and he's officially licensed, so the paint job and the clothing are excellent! Watch the video to hear some sample sounds.

title: My daughter is 44 inches tall, and these fit nicely...
text: I think the most important thing you want to know is whether or not this will fit your child, and in order for you to know that, you need to see another child for reference. So here it is... My girl is not yet 6, about 44 inches tall, and about 39 lbs, so she's on the lighter side. These outfits fit her pretty nicely. Base on this reference, I hope that will help you make a decision. Is it worth it? To see them giddy and happy.. yes it is! You save a little versus buying these outfits separately at Party City or something.

title: Overpriced for a RC toy that doesn't work on carpet...
text:
There are so many RC toys on Amazon that does some amazing things that do not cost $50. Right off the bat, I'm knocking 1 star for the price. The pranks get old really quick because there aren't many.

1. Squirt water at someone.
2. Punch someone.
3. The sound effects button that will cycle through certain noises like passing gas, flushing toilet, breaking glass, etc.
4. Using the Robot as a MIC to sneak up and talk/scream at people.

Essentially, it's just an RC robot that makes funny sounds. The wheels are puny, and so going on carpet is a no-no, so I'll knock a star for that as well. The more I thought about this toy, I wondered.. "Are we teaching kids to be obnoxious?" Something to think about before you make this purchase.

title: Very cool Lego compatible RC robot...
text: [[VIDEOID:bf81b2040c0e95f289d3f47568c3d256]] This is pretty much a Lego-like set. The pieces are compatible with your standard Legos. So you can add more to him and modify your robot if you wish. It also promotes parent/children bonding time. I put this robot together with my 8 yr old kid. You can control it with the physical remote, or by an app via bluetooth. There is so much more to do with the app, such as coding it's path then hit the button to see the results, controlling via gyro, and voice. However, the VOICE hasn't been working for us. It worked on the first day we put it together, then a week later, it didn't work. I'm not surprised, products that depend on apps can be rendered useless if your phone has an update that it doesn't like. My phone is the Oneplus 5th. So for the app to always be working in tip top condition, you would need this company to be on top of its game with all the phones on the market. LOL! I don't expect that. I expect functions to be broken sooner or later because of lack of up-keep, especially from unknown brands that are white label products. I've seen this robot sold under different brands, so this is for sure a white label item from China. So don't ever lose your physical remote. One important tip I do have.. once you're connected by the phone, your physical remote won't work anymore, and simply disconnecting from the app won't work. To get the robot and remote to respond to each other again, you need to disconnect from app, turn off your robot, and also be sure your physical remote is turned off too. Then turn on your robot again, and turn on your physical remote again. Now they will be paired again. I'll give this 4 stars.

title: Osmo's update to an oldie but goodie...
text:
This is basically a refresh or update on older Osmo products. The Tangrams, letters and numbers have been offered before in a different type of packaging. Check out my photos for the "Old packaging." But we really like these new Tupperware type cases. They stack and take up less space. The old ones stack too via magnets, but as you can see in the picture, the boxes were much bigger. Your children are in for a treat if this is your first Osmo kit. Be sure to get the Creativity kit too, so you can play the Monster game. IMO, Monster is the best of all their offerings. You'll need a dry erase board for that game.

As with all our Osmo reviews, we make sure to emphasize this point... How much your children get out of it depends on if you have case for your Fire tablet and how hard it is to remove that case. No case, or an easy to remove case means you will play it a lot. A hard to remove case is a deterrent that will make you not play it as much. Simple as that. I recommend getting an easy to remove case and let your children play Osmo as often as possible. 5-stars!

title: Awesome saber for the young and old... (no longevity)
text:
[[VIDEOID:70401b9086e08489b8471006d9a7ceb7]] March 2, 2021 UPDATE:
--------------------------
This was adult owned and taken care of. Mainly used for display, and sparingly demo'ed in the 6 months that I've owned it. I hadn't turned it on for a long while, probably several months. I decided to test it out again, and it wouldn't turn on. I've charged it for over 5 hours. There is a red light to indicate it's charging, but still won't turn on. No longevity for this item. Reducing review to 1-star.

Original Review:
------------------
Very fun light saber! Has a good heft to it and feels high quality. The handle is some sort of aluminum or metal. This looks much better than those plasticky toys. But as usual, with all these sabers on the market, the worst looking part is the the plastic tube. Our tech isn't there yet, but hopefully one day, we can get rid of that plastic tube and have a real solid light beam out! In any case, here are the controls:

-Single click button once to turn on.
-Single click button again to hear effect.
-While it's on, Double click for a blasting sound which the manual calls "lockup mode." It will stay at this sound until you Double Click again to get out of it.
-While it's on, triple click to change colors (this is finicky though)
-Press & hold button to turn off.
-To change the sound "theme," while it's off, hold the button, you will hear a sound theme. Hold the button again to hear the next sound theme, hold it again to hear the next, etc. There is a total of 4 themes, one of which is actually mute.
-To use any of these themes, once you like what you hear, just single click the button to turn on and play. Remember clicking once turns it on, but holding the button would cause it to cycle through the themes. But once on, to get back to cycling through the themes, you need to press & hold to turn off first, then press & hold to cycle through the themes.

My kids have a few sabers from the out of business toy store. This one belongs to daddy. LOL! I'm knocking 1 star for the finicky controls and instructions that were a little hard to figure out. 4 stars.

title: If you're new to Osmo, you're in for a treat...
text:
We love Osmo and so we've grabbed any edition we can get, but we soon realize that many of their offerings are just updates of the same products. Nothing is new in this package except for the board and the dry erase pouch. They've sold boards before but this one seems to be redesigned a little. The dry erase pouch is now red instead of blue. The three games you would use are the same games: Monster, Newton and Masterpiece. Young and old will love Monster! Even if you're an adult, you will get a kick outta seeing your drawing come to life on screen.

As with all our Osmo reviews, we make sure to emphasize this point... How much your children get out of it depends on if you have case for your Fire tablet and how hard it is to remove that case. No case, or an easy to remove case means you will play it a lot. A hard to remove case is a deterrent that will make you not play it as much. Simple as that. I recommend getting an easy to remove case and let your children play Osmo as often as possible. 5-stars!

title: Drives amazing in grass, gravel, rocky roads...
text:
This is my son's first "serious" RC car, and we love it. I put "serious" in quotes because I know you can spend 4 to 5 times this if you truly get into it and become a RC enthusiasts. But he's 8 yrs old and this is made for 14+, so it's "serious" for him. LOL!

-Great suspension
-Rugged body
-Brushed Motor includes heatsink
-Lights for nighttime racing
-Electronics are waterproof
-Truck is 1 lb 11 oz without batteries
-Controller is .6 oz without batteries.

Put a camera on this thing and have fun!

title: This kit is way too cool...
text:
[[VIDEOID:13f19ec84aca7dd88520b093eab71ede]] This product is gnarly, and I mean that in a super duper way! This kit is way too cool. Due to distance learning with the kids, I haven't had time to go through these projects with my kids, but we opened it up to check it out and it is awesome! This is the very definition of INTERACTIVE. There are two main visual experiences:

1. Images will pop out of the book on your phone when you aim it at the book. The app that you use, called VR Universe, is in some way "connected" to the book. It's like scanning a barcode. So when you place your camera to scan a page, the magic happens. I recorded my screen to show you exactly what I'm talking about, so watch the video! I grew up with Viewmasters in the 1980's. My mind would have been blown away had something like this existed back then.

2. It will instruct you to put on the provided VR Goggles to view educational virtual reality videos.

For #2, I don't like removing my case from my phone, so there is a way for you to adjust the VR google so that it will accommodate thicker phones, or phone with case. It's as simple as removing a few screws, just look at my pictures. On top of the visual experiences are the awesome science projects that your kids can complete. 5-stars!

title: Very cute and funny RC dinosaur toy...
text: I collect dinosaur toys, bones, museum quality figurines, etc. So when I saw this and the description of this toy, I chuckled and I knew I had to add it to my collection. Shoot it a few times, he roars, lights up and is angry, shoot it a few more times and his hands droop, shoot one last time and he falls down. My kids love it, and we like to demonstrate it when their friends come over. Great RC toy, especially for dinosaur enthusiasts.

title: Collect 10 coins to trade in for a prize...
text: One of my favorite movies growing up was Darby O'Gill & the Little People. This bag and coins remind me of that movie for some reason. I think it would look real good next to a Leprechaun doll in your display or something. But I digress, we got these coins to use as a reward system for our children. Do something good, chore, etc., and receive a gold coin. Collect 10 coins and you can trade them in for a prize. Each coin is about .2 oz, and the whole bag weighs about 1 lb 5 oz. They feel great in the hands, especially when you're holding the whole bag. You can really feel the weight and quality. 5 stars.

title: More than a starter set...
text: This is more than a starter set, you can proudly display this on your end desk or coffee table. The drawers to keep your chess pieces are infinitely more convenient than the sets where you have to put the pieces back into their individual slots. It is approximately 13 x 13 square and the workmanship for the price is very acceptable. Lastly, a little shake or bump of the coffee table and your pieces will still be in place due to the magnetic design. We love it. 5 stars.

title: Instructions are wrong on the brown box...
text:
If you received this item in AMZ frustration free type packaging, the instructions are wrong on the brown box. The web address it instructs you to go to takes you to a page that tells you to go get your iPad. But this set is for Amazon tablets, so customers could be confused. There is also a newer app that unifies all these coding games, but I could not find such an app on the Amazon app store. So just download the following apps individually:

Coding Awbie
Coding Jam
Coding Duo

Games are fun and my kids enjoy it, but in my experience with Osmo games, the one thing that will deter you from playing it as much as you should is the type of case you have. If you have a case that makes it a hassle to remove your tablet, then won't play it as much. Simple as that. So if you want to get the most out of Osmo, put your tablet in an easy to remove case. Knocking 1 star for the bad instructions.

title: Easy to assemble, hours of fun...
text: [[VIDEOID:9fbb192f8cce44b0f5482b21a652b3b6]] My kids are having a blast with this set. There are 3 main track lay-outs that the instructions give, but if you already own hot wheel tracks, you can construct it any way you want. Let your imagination run wild. Prior to receiving this item, I wasn't quite sure what hot wheels and batteries would entail. Growing up, I never had any Hot Wheels that involves batteries. As it turns out, the batteries are for the "booster" rubber belts. It rubber spins really fast and when the cars go through it, it is given a boost. The boost is powerful enough for the cars to make it all the way back for repeated boosts, so the cars keep going and going, and gives the illusion that the system is using electronic cars. Terrific set to your Hot Wheels collection. 5 stars.

title: Perfect distance learning accessory...
text: These have been great for distance learning. We normally use legos for the singles and stacking tens. But you cannot do the 100's unless you use a base plate, and who's going to spend time doing that? LOL! Now, we can easily reach for a 100 plate for a visual, and I'm sure the thousand cube will be useful in the near future. 5 stars!

title: Open your packaging carefully, the cardboard is important...
text: The packaging came to us beat up, so my kids just went ahead ripped through it to get to the figures. But it turns out the cardboard is part of the set. It was perforated, and you build some sort of shield from it. The shield is place in front of the robots, to stop them from fighting, and then when removed, they start battling. That's how I think it's supposed to work, but it never worked that way for us. Even with shield in front of them, they were like mad dogs ready to go. They are like minions on steroids. LOL! When one gets knocked down, the other does a happy dance. We still don't understand the ins and outs of this toy, but I'm guessing the more they battle, the more skills you unlock. Their belt level changes, how, I'm not sure yet. We just have them battle and all of a sudden, you'd hear an announcement that new belt level is achieved. The colors of their eyes will change to reflect their belt level. We this really fun. We love it.

title: Get an easy to remove case for your iPad...
text:
The dry erase pad in this package is just that, a flimsy pad. It's not like you can play with the erase pad in your hands or anything, so it shouldn't matter, but I just wanted to mention that because in previous bundles Osmo used to include a high quality dry erase board. You should also know that any dry erase board will work. You can buy the biggest board you can find at an office store, and put this Osmo base on it and it will work.

As I've mentioned in my other Osmo reviews, what type of case you have for your iPad will determine how often you play Osmo games. Some of us have very rugged kid cases for our children that are hard to remove. We have those colorful big rubber rugged cases for our kids and it is a chore to remove, put back, remove, put back. So I don't think we play Osmo games as much as we should. If you want your children to get the most out of Osmo, you first need to get an easier case for your iPad, so that the case doesn't become a deterrent. .

Lastly, the compatibility should be emphasized... "All iPads except Generation 1, iPad Pro 11-inch and iPad Pro 12.9-inch. The minimum iOS version needed is iOS 9."

As for the games itself, they are top notch, and there are plenty of YT videos to learn more about them. 5 stars!

title: Important advice... get an easy to remove case for your iPad!
text:
Must have for interactive fun and learning! But this is the most important advice I have for you... Some of us have very rugged kid cases for our children that are hard to remove. So believe it or not, the type of case you have will determine how often you play Osmo games. We have those colorful big rubber rugged cases for our kids and it is a chore to remove, put back, remove, put back. So I don't think we play Osmo games as much as we could or should. If you want to really invest in this, and really want your children to get the most out of it, you first need to get an easier case for your iPad, so that it doesn't become a deterrent whenever you want them to play.

Lastly, the compatibility should be emphasized... "All iPads except Generation 1, iPad Pro 11-inch and iPad Pro 12.9-inch. The minimum iOS version needed is iOS 9."

As for the games itself, they are top notch, and there are plenty of YT videos to learn more about them. 5 stars!

title: Of all the toy cameras, this one is the biggest screen...
text: [[VIDEOID:3784f0d2db63c628fb4ebd5a0225d8ff]] Nice wide 3.5 inch screen, easy to navigate. It has all the usual features of putting weird graphics on your subject before you snap the shot. For example, putting Santa Claus hat and beard on your subject. LOL! Very fun for the kids. If you watch my video, you'll see how easy it is to navigate.

title: Start at 3 yrs old.....
text:
To get the most bang for your buck, get this for a baby who just turned three. Box says 4-6, but I don't think so. Perhaps in the 80's and 90's. But children today are surrounded by so much tech. Unless, you are supers strict and your kids from 4 to 6 yrs old have never ever seen or use a tablet, I don't think this robot will keep their interest for long. Definitely not for kids older than 6. I have a 5 yr old and this barely interested her, but that's my fault. She lives in a house full of tech, gadgets and toys. Here's the main problem in a nutshell, I tell my daughter, "If you do this, this and that, mTiny will go here, here and there." She essentially says, "But if we get rid of the props, I can control her to anywhere in the house." mTiny basically is an RC toy. Take any RC toy, If you push this on the remote, the car goes there. Isn't that, in essence, computational thinking too?

So far she's not that into it, but I'll continue to try and I'll update this review if we have a breakthrough. But she's always been a little too clever for her age. When she was 2.5 yrs, during one dinner night, she asked for some juice while I just closed the fridge with items in both my hands. I don't want her to have too much juice either, so I said, "I can't right now, I don't have any hands." She said if I put down one of the items on the counter next to me, then I'll have a free hand. LOL!

This is 5 stars in terms of hardware, but I'm knocking a star for content because I think it should have been marketed towards 3-5. Or, please come up with more challenging content for kids in the 5-7 yrs range.

title: Great value, especially for the metal chess pieces...
text:
Weight of each pieces...
---------------------------
King 1.7 oz
Horse 1.5 oz
Queen 1.3 oz
Bishop 1.1 oz
Pawn .9 oz

I got this mainly for the metal chess pieces. I see listings on Amazon for the metal pieces alone, and they will start around $45 without a board. I thought surely those "pieces only" sets must be of higher quality than the metal pieces that are bundled with a board, so I weighed all the pieces in this set to compare. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the pieces in this set are just as heavy, if not heavier. For example, there is a listing for a metal set that cost $65 alone with no board. The King in that set is 3 inches tall, but only weighs 1.3 oz. The King in this set is only 2.75 inches tall, but weighs 1.7 oz. All the pieces have good padding on the bottom, and the board which doubles as a storage case too is just icing on the cake. 5 stars!

title: Perfect fidget gadget at the desk...
text: A Netflix documentary on speed cubers made me order this. LOL!  I always wondered how these cubers can twist the cube so fast, even more perplexing is when they do it with one hand... well now I know. The last time I owned a rubik's cube was sometime in the 80's. The cubes we grew up were rigid or tight. The cubes that are used in tournaments can twist and turn buttery smooth, just like the cubes in this listing. Very smooth, and you can twist them easily with one hand too.. so here's a thought.. why not use it as a fidget gadget too? Lastly, since they are sticker-less, these will age better. They won't look ugly like your old peeling Rubik's cube from the past.

title: From a Miko vs Vector perspective...
text:
[[VIDEOID:806ce296931b008ec9e325daf5456c6e]] We are owners of a Vector robot by Anki, so we can provide a little perspective. I think you have to at least own one robot in a similar price range to know what is reasonable expectation. If Miko is your first robot, your expectations might be too low or too high. So I think I can give you a balance opinion.

Artificial Intelligence... Vector wins.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Vector is like Pinocchio trying to be a real boy. Miko is a smart device that moves on command. Imagine if Alexa, Siri or Google was given a Robot body in the shape of an egg, that's Miko! If you're looking for a robot that's more independent and feels more real, Vector is what you want. Vector truly feels like a pet with the convenience of never having to feed it or take it for a walk. LOL! When you physically touch or nudge Vector, it reacts. If you tap the floor in front of him, his eyes will look down, if you waive your hand over his head, his head will look up. You can tell it gets excited to see you. It is happy when you stroke it, and gets mad when you lift him in the air for too long. Miko is not like that, nor does Miko move around autonomously like Vector. You have to to initiate "AUTOPILOT" in order for Miko to move around herself. And when she's on autopilot, some default music is playing, basically the theme music you hear in their Miko ads. When she bumps into something, she has a few phrases, one of which is "Not again!" But it all feels programmed, it does not feel like a pet roaming around with independent thinking. It can bump into the same spot over and over. Whereas with Vector, when you put him in a new environment, he will scan the room, and take 360 degree snapshots of his environment so he can roam around more intelligently. When you interrupt him, he'll react, when you pick him up, he gets mad, he wants you to put him down. When you interrupt Miko on Autopilot, nothing happens. You can put your hands in front of her, and she'll move in another direction because of her sensors, but that's about it. If you use the wake word, "Hello Miko," she will respond, but she will no longer be on autopilot, and you'll need to manually start it again. They should at least put an update where you can tell Miko to go on autopilot using voice. It's basically like a Roomba that you set on autopilot. Vector feels like a living thing because you can interrupt him, and interact with him, then when you leave him alone, he goes about his business moving around again. You can tell Vector to come to you, and he will like a real pet. Miko does not come to you like that. She may move forward, but she does not come to your direction. Vector knows where the direction of the command is coming from and he will move towards that direction. You can make a loud banging noise and Vector will react like a nosy human, his head will move as if asking, "What was that noise?" Meanwhile, Miko will stand motionless, there is no reaction to the environment. When Vector's battery is drained, he knows how to find his charging dock and dock himself. Meaning you could be away for awhile, come back and find Vector on his charging dock, but that doesn't mean he hasn't been snooping around. LOL! With Miko, there is no charging dock. She'll let you know she needs more juice, and you'll have to charge her. Lastly, as is, Miko only recognizes one face, whereas Vector can recognize multiple faces and call your correct name. I think Miko actually doesn't even recognize any faces, for that matter. This is how I know... When you introduce yourself and tell her your name, JACK, you become the default profile. Then when you ask Miko "who am I," she'll say JACK correctly. Now if you have someone else introduce herself as JILL, she now becomes the new default. So if Jack comes back and ask, "Who am I?" Miko will say JILL. She basically just calls you by the name of the last person introduced. So currently, there is no intelligent facial recognition like Vector.

Which one has more games and learning apps? Miko wins.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
I guess this would be the bread and butter of Miko. Vector has a tiny interface to show his facial emotions and a few games like black jack, but there's not a lot to do with Vector in terms of apps. He is not app-centric, Miko is app-centric. Both robots have the usual general knowledge AI. You can ask both robots questions like who's the president, what time is it, math, definitions, etc. Basically all the types of general knowledge you would ask Alexa, Siri or Hey Google. But on top of the general knowledge, Miko has a big colorful screen with lots of learning apps. The games will require the child to interact and press buttons to give or to get answers. This is the main advantage Miko has over Vectors. So that's why I say Miko feels like a tablet that moves on command. I guess the plan is for Miko to continue to develop and add to their app store, which is called the TALENT HOUSE. I've seen a coding app that they are asking $30 for. But most apps are free. This would be equivalent to the Skills section of the Alexa app. The more you add, the more things your Miko will do. Again, you want Vector if you want something that feels more life like, something to play with. He has a cube that he likes to play with, so you can ask him to flip his cube, pick up his cube, etc. Like a dog with tricks. Miko has no moving arms, and does not interact physically with you.

Miko has a neat Video calling feature.
--------------------------------------------
Because it has the advantage of the big screen, one neat feature of the Miko is that you can call it from your smartphone, but within the Miko app. I assume this will work from anywhere. It's basically wifi calling with video. So you'll be able to see your kids when they answer, and they'll be able to see you. Can't do that with Vector! You can also move Miko during this video call using directional buttons in the app.

Wake word.. Miko wins.
---------------------------
How is this even a category for competition? LOL! But you see, with Vector, the wake word is "Hey Vector," but you have to wait for him to turn blue, then you have to say "I have a question.." Then wait for Vector to say, "Ready!" Then you can ask your question. This is probably the #1 complaint of Vector. It doesn't feel like a natural conversation like it does with Alexa, Siri or Google. Miko wins here because asking her general questions is just like Alexa. You say, "Hello Miko," when she turns green, you proceed with your question. Not convoluted like Vector. I will say this.. Vector has Alexa built in. So you can actually bypass Vector for general knowledge and just say, "Alexa!" This way, you won't need to say "I have a question." But it's just weird to hear Alexa's voice in Vector's body.

The VOICE.. Vector wins.
----------------------------
Vector sounds like a cute robot. Miko sounds like your very dull and boring Auntie. LOL! There are 4 voices to choose from in Miko's app, one of which is a man's voice, but they don't sound all that much better. For such a cute and colorful device, it's strange to have such dull choices for the voices.

Availability.. Miko wins.
---------------------------
Why am I talking so much about Vector, a robot who's creator company Anki, is out of business? LOL! Well, that's because Digital Dreams Lab has continued on with Vector. They bought the rights, and they were on Kickstarter to provide new life to Vector for a fee, including an escape pod feature that supposedly will allow Vector to be fully functional forever even if Digital Dreams Lab goes out of business. But now, I think Vector cost a little more in the secondary market.

Conclusion:
--------------
There is potential here. Ultimately, I might be comparing apples to oranges. I have no idea about what goes on behind the scenes in AI, programming, coding, etc. The path in development for these two could be so different that asking one to be more like the other could be unreasonable. You can't ask Vector to have more apps and games, right? It wasn't develop with a big screen. Likewise, you probably can't ask Miko to be more like vector since it wasn't built with any arms. I would sum it up as Miko being App-Centric, and Vector is Movement-Centric. If you're interested in something more like a smart device/tablet that could move, get Miko. If you're more interested in the physical interaction with a robot, that's more on the side of a real learning AI, then get Vector.

Reasonable improvements I'd like Miko to make:

-Ability to turn off music in auto pilot.
-Ability to turn on apps, including auto pilot by voice.
-Ability to turn off apps by voice as well. Right now, if Miko is dancing or playing music, you cannot voice her to stop. You have to grab her and push the stop button.

I hope this company sticks around and improves on Miko!

title: The biggest LCD doodle board you can buy!
text: What you are paying for here is the real estate. These LCD writing tablets can be found much cheaper and usually comes in a package of 2. This is one tablet for $32. If you carefully do your research, you can the same 16 inch cheaper on Amazon. So I'm knocking a star for being a little overpriced. Both our kids will start fall with Distance Learning, so I grabbed a few of these knowing they will be useful as electronic scratch pads. Lastly, they are not as bright as the stock photos suggest, even fully charged. But still, it is bright enough to work with. I actually would prefer it if they had just gone with 1 white led color, instead of the rainbow effect because the darker colors don't pop. Not just for children, if you hang this up in your kitchen, it's a notepad for the adults.

title: Best looking toy camera in its class...
text: [[VIDEOID:8f794fb4afd3dae7e39d47496016a077]] Of all the toy cameras, this one looks the best. The stock photos make it look like you can zoom the lens. LOL! But of course you can't. The lens mold on other versions look like toys, but the mold on this one looks like a real lens. The manual isn't great, so I hope my video will help cut your learning curve. I think the volume is kinda low, so please pump up the volume. Most reviewers are saying they got it for their 5 yr old... guess what? Me too. LOL! I'm knocking one star because I think it's overpriced. It's the best looking one, but shouldn't cost twice as much. At this price range, Vtech has better cameras.

title: Easy to control! Good price for a decent size boat!
text:
[[VIDEOID:1f9002ea97cd0f2905b85a04900d29a0]] Our kids aren't really into RC vehicles. When I was a kid, I thought they were the coolest things. Sign of the times I guess. Plus, we have a swimming pool, so not much space in the backyard to play rc cars. So when I saw this boat, it was a must try! The packaging, the unknown brand, the Styrofoam, everything was nostalgic. Because it reminded me of those toys you would find at downtown swap-meets, or Chinatown. LOL! But I must say, it works very well. When I want it to turn, it turns, it is very accurate. I like making it go in circles. One last thing I'll mention, there is a clear plastic piece that seemed important because it was in its own little bag. The instructions didn't talk it and for the longest time, I didn't know what it was for. When I went to take pictures for this review, it became obvious... it's a stand for the boat. LOL! I was going to knock a star for pricing, but then I decided to do a little research first, and I realize these things aren't cheap. This is as low as it gets on Amazon for a decent size boat. So I give it 5 stars.

Regarding accessing the battery...
---------------------------------------
You might find that the seat cover is too difficult to remove. You'll have to yank it out the first time. But after you do, you can loosen the screw for the black tab to make it easier on you the next time. We've been pulling it several times now, and I can start to see the stress in the plastic. Loosening the screw makes it a lot easier. Look at the last picture.

title: Even adult collectors will be giddy.
text: My kid has a bunch of Imaginext sets and he was blown away by these XL figures. Look how Superman is man-handling a standard size Batman in the picture. LOL!  I included a soda can in the pictures for reference. We would collect them all if they made more. So far, it's only Superman and Batman.

title: Must have for Imaginext fans!
text: My kid has a bunch of Imaginext sets and he was blown away by these XL figures. In my pictures you'll see a standard size figure next to the XL figure. But for even more reference, I included a soda can. For $10 it's a no brainer. We would collect them all if they made more. So far, it's only Batman and Superman.

title: Best price for this white label model!
text: These are super fun for the kids. Trying to find things for them to do during this social distancing thing. This is a white label product, meaning you will see it offered in different names by different sellers. I was going to buy a set that was about $25 because it had better reviews, but then upon close examination of the stock photos, I realize these are the same guns in different color schemes. It also tried to differentiate itself by using the measurement term OZ instead of CC. There is no rhyme or reason as to why one white label product gets higher reviews than others. It's a psychological herd mentality thing. If a listing gets a lucky good start, people follow. If a listing gets an unlucky bad start, then others will pile on bad reviews, and it stays buried in Amazon's search engine. Don't be fooled by reviews, take your time and look at the photos, and if both companies are unknown brands, then why pay more? It's an entirely different story if one brand is Nerf and one is an unknown, then you know it's a knockoff.  But if both listings are from unknown companies, then the reviews don't matter, just go with the lower price.  My 5 and 7 yr old can use it just fine. The pumping isn't difficult if they just pump a few times. But for a really long-range, you need to pump a lot and the more you pump, the harder it is to pump. So all you Daddys still need to stick around and help them if they want to shoot really far. You're not off the hook. LOL!

title: Very bright and cute with one problem
text: These are wonderful but all of the small face ones in the set (which is the smallest #) that I got were not perforated. I normally buy things like this for large groups so immediately realized what was not so bad at home, where I could cut them out for just one toddler, could be a big problem with a large group. If I were doing a large group using these, I would either pre-cut around the small faces and fold back a bit of the paper to help with peeling off or I'd have scissors out for those helping the kids and give them a heads up about this problem. It would not be enough of an issue for me, to not use them, but I would sure like to know about this issue in advance.

title: Stinky Cute
text: These have a very toxic odor, enough to make your eyes burn right out of the box but they are very cute and we like everything else about them. We deemed them too smelly to air in our garage so put them on back deck in fresh air. We may need to do a vinegar water rinse, which we've had success with before on another product that had a similar smell; the odor dissapeared after airing and rinse, it didn't returned. Sure hoping we can eliminate the stink again because we want to keep them.

title: This is a very cute wood instrument that really works.
text: This instrument is solid and adorable. We bought it as a gift to be played with dad. We did not want an electronic instrument but one they could really play while dad played his.

title: Nice wood shoes!

title: Great quality and colors

title: 5 butterfies are now ready to be set free!
text: This was successful; they arrived intact within their container. Directions were easy to follow. Care was easy. Now 5 butterflies will be set free!

title: This phone only worked for half a day so we don't recommend it.
text: The phone arrived in great condition and worked straight out of package and enjoyed for half a day. We thought it needed to be charged and it appeared charger was working but sadly, the phone would not work again. title: These were a10-month old Win!
